support_summary: ATXN3 and VCP cooperate to regulate the turnover of LAMP2 on lysosomes

functions.cellular_process: Regulated degradation of damaged lysosomal membrane proteins to restore organelle functionality.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 and VCP/p97 coordinate the removal of K48-K63-branched ubiquitin conjugates from damaged lysosomes, promoting the microautophagic degradation of a subset of LAMP2 to enable membrane remodeling.
biological_consequence: Lysosomal damage → Recruitment of ATXN3/VCP complex → Deubiquitination of K48-K63-branched chains on LAMP2 → Facilitated microautophagic degradation of damaged LAMP2 → Lysosomal membrane regeneration → Restoration of degradative capacity.
specific_effects: Facilitates degradation of a fraction of LAMP2 protein following damage
Restores lysosomal re-acidification and degradative flux

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3 regulates lysosome regeneration after damage by targeting K48-K63-branched ubiquitin chains
evidence.relevant_quote: ATXN3 thus facilitates degradation of a fraction of LAMP2 via microautophagy to regenerate the lysosomal membrane and to thereby reestablish degradative capacity needed also for completion of lysophagy.

mechanism_correction: ATXN3, in complex with VCP/p97, is recruited to damaged lysosomes where it targets and processes K48-K63-branched ubiquitin chains on lysosomal membrane proteins, specifically facilitating the degradation of a fraction of LAMP2 via microautophagy. This regulated turnover of damaged membrane components is essential for lysosome regeneration and the restoration of degradative capacity (lysophagy completion).
mechanism: Regulated degradation of damaged lysosomal membrane proteins to restore organelle functionality.
effect: ATXN3 and VCP/p97 coordinate the removal of K48-K63-branched ubiquitin conjugates from damaged lysosomes, promoting the microautophagic degradation of a subset of LAMP2 to enable membrane remodeling.
summary: ATXN3 activates LAMP2 to modulate lamp2 regulated turnover & lysosomal regeneration, ultimately affecting restoration of degradative capacity.

initial_pathway.reasoning: ATXN3 is required for maintaining lysosomal integrity and promoting lysosome regeneration after damage, a process involving the lysosomal membrane protein LAMP2.
